ResourceHeader.ResourceName: C1 Waves of High frequency and Sounder for Probing of Electron density by Relaxation (WHISPER) Electric Wave Form Power Density, Cluster Active Archive Parameter (CP), 0.2 second Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Initial release of metadata, ADAPT generated, LFB

ResourceHeader.Description: The Wave of HIgh frequency and Sounder for Probing of Electron density by Relaxation (WHISPER) performs the measurement of the electron density on the four satellites of the CLUSTER project. The two main purposes of the WHISPER experiment are to record the natural waves and to make a diagnostic of the electron density using the sounding technique. The various working modes and the fourier transforms calculated on board provide a good frequency resolution obtained in the bandwidth 2-83 kHz. Onboard data compression by the Digital Wave Processing (DWP) intrument allows a good dynamic and level resolution of the electric signal amplitude.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the WHISPER team and the ESA Cluster Archive in any publication based upon use of this data. Digital Object Identifier for the WHISPER archive: https://doi.org/10.5270/esa-6stdo07

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the Principal Investigator P. Henri. Please acknowledge the Data Providers and CDAWeb when using these Data.

Parameter.Name: Delta
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: time_tags__C1_CP_WHI_WAVE_FORM_ENERGY
Parameter.Description: Half the sampling duration + uncertainty of time tags (in seconds)

Parameter.Name: Energy Value
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: time_tags__C1_CP_WHI_WAVE_FORM_ENERGY

Parameter.Name: Presence of Spectrum Code
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: time_tags__C1_CP_WHI_WAVE_FORM_ENERGY
Parameter.Description: Wave form energies and natural spectra are acquired onboard simultaneously and then undergo the same time-averaging processing. However, only a selection of natural spectra is transmitted to ground (1/4 or 1/8, chosen by telecommand) while all energies are transmitted. The Spectrum_Code parameter is equal to 1 if the corresponding natural spectrum has been transmitted to ground and 0 otherwise. Natural spectra can be found in the Ci_CP_WHI_NATURAL dataset.

Parameter.Name: Average Number
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: time_tags__C1_CP_WHI_WAVE_FORM_ENERGY
Parameter.Description: Number of averaged individual spectra (formed every 13.33 ms)

Parameter.Name: Overflow Code Value
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: time_tags__C1_CP_WHI_WAVE_FORM_ENERGY
